refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Known Implementations
refsect1.para: GSeekable is implemented by GFileOutputStream, GMemoryInputStream, GMemoryOutputStream and GFileInputStream.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GSeekable is implemented by streams (implementations of GInputStream or GOutputStream) that support seeking.

refsect2.title: GSeekableIface
refsect2.para: Provides an interface for implementing seekable functionality on I/O Streams.

listitem.simpara: The parent interface.
Tells the current location within a stream.
Checks if seeking is supported by the stream.
Seeks to a location within a stream.
Chekcs if truncation is suppored by the stream.
Truncates a stream.

refsect2.title: g_seekable_tell ()
refsect2.para: Tells the current position within the stream.

listitem.simpara: a GSeekable.
the offset from the beginning of the buffer.

refsect2.title: g_seekable_can_seek ()
refsect2.para: Tests if the stream supports the GSeekableIface.

listitem.simpara: a GSeekable.
TRUE if seekable can be seeked. FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_seekable_seek ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_seekable_seek (GSeekable *seekable, goffset offset, GSeekType type, GCancellable *cancellable, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Seeks in the stream by the given offset, modified by type.

If cancellable is not NULL, then the operation can be cancelled by triggering the cancellable object from another thread. If the operation was cancelled, the error G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED will be returned.

listitem.simpara: a GSeekable.
a goffset.
a GSeekType.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
a GError location to store the error occuring, or NULL to ignore.
TRUE if successful. If an error has occurred, this function will return FALSE and set error appropriately if present.

refsect2.title: g_seekable_can_truncate ()
refsect2.para: Tests if the stream can be truncated.

listitem.simpara: a GSeekable.
TRUE if the stream can be truncated, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_seekable_truncate ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_seekable_truncate (GSeekable *seekable, goffset offset, GCancellable *cancellable, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Truncates a stream with a given offset.

If cancellable is not NULL, then the operation can be cancelled by triggering the cancellable object from another thread. If the operation was cancelled, the error G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED will be returned. If an operation was partially finished when the operation was cancelled the partial result will be returned, without an error.

listitem.simpara: a GSeekable.
a goffset.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
a GError location to store the error occuring, or NULL to ignore.
TRUE if successful. If an error has occurred, this function will return FALSE and set error appropriately if present.
